alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:55PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lincoln County through 330 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado near Arriba, or 14 miles west of Flagler, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Arriba and Genoa. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
